Author: sugafreedreams
Text: Because it costs a lot of money and can really wreck your teeth and cause cavities. Bacteria living on the surface of your teeth feed on sugar from the food you chew and spit to multiply and produce acidic gasses in the process, weakening your enamel. In weak spots the enamel eventually corrodes through and causes a cavity.  Chewing sugarless gum can even negate this problem by stimulating saliva production without providing cavity-causing bacteria any sugar to multiply. The motion of chewing in combination with this is why dentists recommend you to chew sugarless gum after meals.
